newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore shares expected to drift sideways.
newsitem.headline: Singapore shares expected to drift sideways.

text.p: Singapore shares are expected to drift mostly sideways with a downward bias on Tuesday as investors stay sidelined.
"Investors just want to wait and see some results before they commit more money into the market and August is usually a quiet month," a broker with a Singapore firm said.
Dealers said the weak performance of Malaysian shares traded over the counter would also continue to weigh down sentiment.
The Straits Times Industrial Index ended at 1,963.60, up 8.35 points, on Monday.
